intro: Klasea potaninii, commonly known as the Potanin's klasea, is a rare and unique species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pale green to white in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Klasea potaninii is considered a species of conservation concern.
